importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The show begins in the 1930s, exploring the family's origins before John F. Kennedy's presidency, marking a key temporal anchor for the narrative.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, tracing the rise of the Kennedy family, including the formative years of Joe Kennedy Sr. and the early lives of his children.

keyTakeAways: Netflix is launching a new drama series titled 'Kennedy' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy Sr., exploring both the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family.
The show begins in the 1930s and follows the ascent of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack Kennedy, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother, Bobby.
The narrative delves into the human struggles behind the Kennedy family myth, drawing parallels to American cultural and political identity.
The series is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr.
The show is set to run for eight episodes and does not yet have a release date.
The showrunner Sam Shaw describes the Kennedys' story as a blend of American mythology and a nuanced exploration of personal and national history.

namedEntities.name: Joe Kennedy Sr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The patriarch of the Kennedy family, father of John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is portrayed by Michael Fassbender, serving as the central character in the series' exploration of the family's rise and struggles.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His political legacy and tragic assassination are part of the family’s mythos, contributing to the narrative depth of the show.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a key character in the series, symbolizing the struggle to break free from the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Author of the biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The distinction between the new Netflix series and Murphy’s project highlights the diversity of Kennedy-related storytelling in media.

namedEntities.name: American Love Story
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Upcoming Ryan Murphy-produced series about JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is explicitly differentiated from the new Netflix series, indicating that multiple narratives about the Kennedy family are emerging in the media landscape.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography of the Kennedy family, which will star Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy Sr. The series begins in the 1930s and traces the family's rise, focusing on the personal struggles and triumphs of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack Kennedy, who battles to escape the shadow of his older brother. The show is described as a blend of American mythology and a nuanced exploration of personal and national history, aiming to reveal the human dimensions behind the Kennedy legacy. It is set to run for eight episodes and will not have a release date at the time of announcement. The series is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
